material.mattext: The main advantage of validating data on the client side using JavaScript is that:
you can prevent information from passing to the server until it is correct.
you can save the server resources from having to process the data at all.
you can compel users to submit only truthful information to your server.
you can provide a more dynamic interface to the user for data collection.
Most form elements use <input> tags with a specific type attribute assigned to them. Which choice lists two form elements that are created with their own X/HTML tags?
select, textarea
select, checkbox
radio, checkbox
button, textarea
Which X/HTML form element produces a single-line text box that displays input as mask characters such as asterisks (***) or dots to mask data entry?
password
hidden
text
textarea
Which X/HTML form element produces an option button in a set of mutually exclusive option buttons?
radio
checkbox
button
select
Which JavaScript object allows the user to choose one or more items from a list box?
The select object
The checkbox object
The radio object
The textarea object
Which JavaScript object allows input of a single line of alphanumeric values and provides programmatic access to these user-entered values?
The text object
The select object
The submit object
The textarea object

Consider the following code:

<form name="form1">
<input type="checkbox" name="choose" />
</form>


How would you refer to the checked attribute of the <input> element in this statement?
document.form1.choose.checked;
form.form1.choose.checked; C
form[1].choose.checked;
document.form[1].choose.checked;
What are the two ways in which you can refer to a form element?
By name or by array index number
By name or by element name
By element name or by array index number
By element name or by entered value
What is the purpose of the JavaScript form object?
To access all properties of the form and elements that compose the form
To create the form elements that appear to users on screen
To create the beginning and ending of the form that appears to users on screen
To access a separate X/HTML page that includes a form
Which of the following is an event handler used by the form object?
onreset
select()
submit()
onclick

The elements on a form need to be initialized with dates for the next week, starting from today. Only the <input> tags of type text need to be initialized. Consider the following XHTML code:

<head>
<script type="text/javascript">
function FillDate() {
var d = new Date();
// insert loop here 
}
</script>
</head>
<body>
<form name="calendarForm">
<input type="text" name="date1"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date2"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date3"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date4"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date5"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date6"></input><br/>
<input type="text" name="date7"></input><br/>
<input type="button" name="fillDates" onclick="FillDate()" value="Fill Days"></input>
</form>
</body>


Given the code, which loop will accomplish this?

for (var i = 0; i < document.calendarForm.length; i++) { if (document.calendarForm.elements[i].type == "text") { d.setDate(d.getDate() + 1); document.calendarForm.elements[i].value = d.toDateString(); } }
for (var i = 0; i < document.calendarForm.length; i++) { if (document.calendarForm.elements[i].type == "text") { d.addDays(1); document.calendarForm.elements[i].value = d.toDateString(); } }

for (var i = 0; i < document.calendarForm.elements.count; i++) { if (document.calendarForm.elements[i].type == "text") { d.setDate(d.getDate() + 1); document.calendarForm.elements[i].value = d.toDateString(); } }

for (var i = 0; i < document.calendarForm.length; i++) { if (document.calendarForm.elements[i].value == "text") { d.setDate(d.getDate() + 1); document.calendarForm.elements[i].type = d.toDateString(); } }
When a user submits a form by clicking a button, which property of the form object specifies a URL to which the form data will be sent for processing?
action
target
name
method
Generally speaking, when is the JavaScript form object available to access in an X/HTML page?
When <form> tags are present in the X/HTML document
Anytime in a correctly structured X/HTML document
When you insert a reference to the form object in your script
When you script any form-related functionality into the X/HTML document
Each form on an X/HTML page is:
represented by a separate instance of the JavaScript form object.
represented by the same instance of the form object as the other forms on that page.
represented by the same instance of the form object as the other forms on the site.
represented by an X/HTML <form> tag but not a JavaScript form object.
Which JavaScript object provides a basic push-button interface and relies on scripting for its functionality, rather than operating in a predefined manner?
The button object
The submit object
The form object
The reset object
What is the main method used by the JavaScript button object?
click()
reset()
submit()
select()
Which property of the button object can you use to specify a string of the text that will be displayed on the button?
The value property
The form property
The name property
The click property
Which example shows the correct generic syntax for the button object?
<input type="button" value="Text on Button" onclick="script to execute" />
<button type="submit" value="Text on Button" click(script to execute) />
<button value="submit" name="Text on Button" onclick="script to execute" />
<input value="button" name="Text on Button" click(script to execute) />

Consider the following XHTML fragment:

<form name="myForm">
<input type="checkbox" name="myCheckbox" />Click
</form>


Given this code, what is the correct way to determine whether the check box is checked?
document.myForm.myCheckbox.checked
document.myForm[0].myCheckbox[0].checked
document.myForm.myCheckbox.ischecked
document.form[0].checkbox[0].ischecked
Which of the following is the main property associated with the JavaScript checkbox object, and returns a Boolean value?
The checked property
The defaultchecked property
The form property
The name property
What is the main event handler used by the JavaScript checkbox object?
onclick
onselect
click()
select()
To JavaScript, what is the difference between a text object and a textarea object?
They are very similar â€” they use the same properties, methods and event handlers.
They both take text as input, but they use different properties, methods and event handlers.
Both are created with the <input> tag, but they use different properties, methods and event handlers.
Both use the same properties, but they use different methods and event handlers.
After a user has entered information into a text field, which property is used to retrieve the information?
The value property
The name property
The defaultValue property
The form property
Which method of the text and textarea objects occurs when the user's cursor moves over the object without clicking?
The focus() method
The blur() method
The select() method
The change() method
Which JavaScript code segment correctly determines which radio button has been selected from a radio button group named myRadio in a form named myForm?
var len = myRadio.length; var myVar = ""; for(var idx = 0; idx < len; idx++) { if(document.myForm.myRadio[idx].checked) { myVar = document.myForm.myRadio[idx].value; } }
var len = myRadio.length; var myVar = ""; for(var idx = 0; idx < len; idx++) { if(document.myForm.myRadio[idx].selected) { myVar = document.myForm.myRadio.value; } }
var len = myRadio.length; var myVar = ""; for(var idx = 0; idx < len; idx++) { if(document.myForm.myRadio[idx].selected) { myVar = document.myForm.myRadio[idx].value; } }
var len = myRadio.length; var myVar = ""; for(var idx = 0; idx < len; idx++) { if(document.myForm.myRadio.checked) { myVar = document.myForm.myRadio[idx].value; } }
The JavaScript radio object allows users to:
choose at most a single response from a group.
choose no, one or more items from a group.
type in their responses to a question.
present a list of links for navigation.
What procedure does your script perform in order to determine which radio button was chosen by the user?
The script will loop through the radio button group, querying the checked property for each element.
In the form object, the radio button group's checked property will return the name of the selected button.
The script will loop through the radio button group, querying the value property for each element.
In the form object, the radio button group's name property will return the name of the selected button.
Which of the following is a valid select list declaration?
<select name="mySelect"> <option> First </option> <option> Second </option> </select>
<select name="mySelect" option="First" option="Second" />
<select name="mySelect" selectOption="First" selectOption="Second" />
<select name="mySelect"> <selectOption> First </option> <selectOption> Second </option> </select>
Which event handler is commonly used when checking the choice made by the user in a select object?
onchange
onblur
onfocus
onselected

Which of the following JavaScript code segments properly accesses the numeric value of the array number returned when a user selects an option from a select object named mySelect in a form named myForm?
var myVar; myVar = document.myForm.mySelect.selectedIndex;
var myVar; myVar = document.myForm.mySelect.value;
var myVar; myVar = document.myForm.mySelect.selected;
var myVar; myVar = document.myForm.mySelect.integer;
What procedure does your script perform in order to determine which options were chosen by the user in a multiple-selection list box?
The script will loop through each option, checking the value of the selected property.
The script will loop through each option, checking the value of the selectedIndex property.
The script will use the selectedOptions array property of the select list. D
The script will use the selectedIndexes array property of the select list.
Which attribute is used to allow the user to choose more than one choice from a select object?
multiple
options
length
select
Which of the following is a benefit of client-side form validation?
Conservation of bandwidth
Decrease in amount of scripting needed
Ability to record input into a database
Ability to verify accuracy of all user input in form submissions
Which of the following statements about client-side validation is true?
Some shortcuts exist to bypass validations.
Client-side validation is completely reliable.
Hackers can bypass validations by re-engineering your code.
Hackers cannot usually identify validations because JavaScript is typically invisible.

You want to create some client-side validations to ensure that your end users answer each of the required questions in your form. For a text field that requires the user to enter the number of years he or she has worked at a past job, you can validate that the user entered an answer by creating a script that detects what?
Whether the field holds a null value after submission
Whether the user entered enough characters
Whether the field value was changed from the default
Whether the user entered truthful information
Which of the following is a recommended practice for form validation with JavaScript?
Always test your form validations in several browsers.
Use validation on most or all fields in a form to decrease the server's load.
Make your messages clear by putting more detail in your alerts.
For efficiency, test multiple fields in a single validation when possible.

Consider the following code:

<input type="text"
name="userName"
onblur="
if (this.value == '') {
alert('Please do not leave the Name field blank.');
this.focus();
}
else {
alert('Thank you, ' + this.value + '!');
}
" />


In this code, the focus() method is used to:
return the user's cursor to the text box if the user left it blank. B
invoke the inline scripting.
refer to the current object.
display the personalized thank-you message to the user.
